Package JourneyPlanner

Class Train

  • java.lang.Object
    • JourneyPlanner.Train
  • public class Train
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a train which moves through a map of stations according to a fixed schedule.
    Author:
    Michael Wade
    See Also:
    Station

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      private int number
      The train number (unique)
      private java.util.Hashtable<java.lang.String,​Time[]> schedule
      Collection of stations this train passes paired with the arrival times on weekdays (index 0), saturdays (index 1), and sundays (index 2)

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Train​(int number)
      Creates a Train object with the given train number and an empty schedule.
      Train​(int number, java.util.Hashtable<java.lang.String,​Time[]> schedule)
      Create a new Train object

        The train number (unique)

        private java.util.Hashtable<java.lang.String,​Time[]> schedule
        Collection of stations this train passes paired with the arrival times on weekdays (index 0), saturdays (index 1), and sundays (index 2)

    • Constructor Detail

      • Train

        public Train​(int number)
        Creates a Train object with the given train number and an empty schedule. Can use addStop(station) to add stations to this trains schedule.
        Parameters:
        number - the train number

      • Train

        public Train​(int number,
             java.util.Hashtable<java.lang.String,​Time[]> schedule)
        Create a new Train object
        Parameters:
        number - : the unique train number
        schedule - : the schedule for this train

    • Method Detail

      • number

        public int number()
        Get the train number for this train

      • getNextArrivalTimeAt

        public Time getNextArrivalTimeAt​(Station station,
                                 Time currentTime)
        Gets the time that this train passes stationName next
        Parameters:
        station - : the target station
        currentTime - : only arrival times after this time are considered
        Returns:
        the next time (after currentTime) that this train passes stationName. Or returns Time.MAX_TIME if the train doesn't pass this station
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if any of the parameters are null

      • getLastArrivalTimeAt

        public Time getLastArrivalTimeAt​(Station station,
                                 Time currentTime)
        Gets the last time that this train passes stationName
        Parameters:
        station - : the target station
        currentTime - : only arrival times before this time are considered
        Returns:
        the last time (before currentTime) that this train passed stationName. Or returns Time.MIN_TIME if the train doesn't pass this station
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if any of the parameters are null

      • addStop

        public void addStop​(java.lang.String station,
                    Time arrivalTime,
                    int dayType)
        Add a stop to this train's schedule. A stop is determined by the station is arrives at and at what time.
        Parameters:
        station - the station the train stops at
        arrivalTime - the arrival time at the station
        dayType - 0 if this stop occurs on a weekday, 1 for saturdays, 2 for sundays
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if station is null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if dayType is not equal to one of 0, 1, 2

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a string representation of the train: "Train [train number], {[station name]=[arrival time], ...}"
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        the string representation
